title.value: A MC-based anthropomorphic test case for commissioning model-based dose calculation in interstitial breast 192-Ir HDR brachytherapy
title.justification: The title clearly outlines the focus of the paper: the development of a test case for model-based dose calculation in interstitial breast cancer treatment.
title.quote: A MC-based anthropomorphic test case for commissioning model-based dose calculation in interstitial breast 192-Ir HDR brachytherapy

extractions.description: The paper presents the development of a clinical test case involving Monte Carlo simulations for commissioning model-based dose calculation algorithms in 192-Ir HDR brachytherapy. It discusses methodology, validation, and potential applications of the dataset for clinical commissioning, intercomparison, and brachytherapy research.

type.justification: The paper involves practical implementation, simulations, and comparisons of dose calculation algorithms to validate the dataset and demonstrate its applications, indicating empirical work.
type.quote: Monte Carlo (MC) simulation was performed in the model using three different codes and information parsed from the treatment plan exported in DICOM radiation therapy (RT) format.

name.justification: The paper extensively discusses dose calculations and treatment planning systems, which are central to Medical Physics.
name.quote: Medical Physics published by Wiley Periodicals LLC on behalf of American Association of Physicists in Medicine.

name.justification: The paper specifically explores dose calculations and test cases for 192-Ir HDR brachytherapy, a type of internal radiation therapy.
name.quote: A MC-based anthropomorphic test case for commissioning model-based dose calculation in interstitial breast 192-Ir HDR brachytherapy

name.justification: The use of Monte Carlo simulations is a key method in evaluating the brachytherapy dose calculations mentioned in the paper.
name.quote: Monte Carlo (MC) simulation was performed in the model using three different codes.

name.justification: The model 'egs_brachy' is highlighted as a key Monte Carlo simulation code used to obtain reference dose data.
name.quote: The validation of independent simulations based on the egs_brachy (EGSnrc), ^{18} RapidBrachyMCTPS (GEANT), ^{20} and MCNP ^{21} codes for obtaining reference dose data.

is_contributed.justification: The paper utilizes existing models such as egs_brachy for simulations rather than contributing a new model.
is_contributed.quote: The validation of independent simulations based on the egs_brachy (EGSnrc), ^{18} RapidBrachyMCTPS (GEANT), ^{20} and MCNP ^{21} codes for obtaining reference dose data.

is_executed.justification: The model was actively used for Monte Carlo simulations as described in the paper.
is_executed.quote: egs_brachy results were selected as the reference MC dataset in view of their relatively lower Type A uncertainty (see Table 2).

is_compared.justification: The model 'egs_brachy' was compared with other Monte Carlo simulation codes like MCNP and RapidBrachyMCTPS to validate its results.
is_compared.quote: The comparison between egs_brachy and MCNP-BrachyGuide, summarized in Figure 3, yielded overall agreement within MC Type A uncertainty (see Table 2).

referenced_paper_title.value: egs_brachy: a versatile and fast Monte Carlo code for brachytherapy
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper title provides detailed information about the 'egs_brachy' model used in this research, which aligns with the validation work described.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Chamberland MJP, Taylor REP, Rogers DWO, Thomson RM. egs_brachy: a versatile and fast Monte Carlo code for brachytherapy.

name.justification: RapidBrachyMCTPS is another Monte Carlo simulation code used in validation alongside egs_brachy.
name.quote: The validation of independent simulations based on the egs_brachy (EGSnrc), ^{18} RapidBrachyMCTPS (GEANT), ^{20} and MCNP ^{21} codes for obtaining reference dose data.

is_contributed.justification: The model RapidBrachyMCTPS is an existing system integrated into the study for validation purposes, not a new contribution.
is_contributed.quote: RapidBrachyMCTPS: a Monte Carlo-based treatment planning system for brachytherapy applications.

is_executed.justification: The paper demonstrates the execution of RapidBrachyMCTPS code for validation through dose calculations.
is_executed.quote: The comparison between egs_brachy and RapidBrachyMCTPS, summarized in Figure 4, also showed close agreement within MC type A uncertainties.

is_compared.justification: RapidBrachyMCTPS code outputs were compared with egs_brachy to validate simulation results.
is_compared.quote: The comparison between egs_brachy and RapidBrachyMCTPS, summarized in Figure 4, also showed close agreement within MC type A uncertainties.

referenced_paper_title.value: RapidBrachyMCTPS: a Monte Carlo-based treatment planning system for brachytherapy applications.
referenced_paper_title.justification: The cited paper refers to the RapidBrachyMCTPS model used for Monte Carlo dose calculations, complementing the study's validation focus.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Famulari G, Renaud MA, Poole CM, Evans MDC, Seuntjens J, Enger SA. RapidBrachyMCTPS: a Monte Carlo-based treatment planning system for brachytherapy applications.

name.justification: MCNP is identified as a third Monte Carlo code crucial for establishing the research's reference dose data.
name.quote: The validation of independent simulations based on the egs_brachy (EGSnrc), ^{18} RapidBrachyMCTPS (GEANT), ^{20} and MCNP ^{21} codes for obtaining reference dose data.

is_contributed.justification: MCNP is an established code utilized in the study for validation, not an original contribution of the paper.

is_executed.justification: The paper utilizes MCNP for independent simulation runs to verify results.
is_executed.quote: The comparison between egs_brachy and MCNP-BrachyGuide, summarized in Figure 3, yielded overall agreement within MC Type A uncertainty (see Table 2).

is_compared.justification: MCNP was compared to egs_brachy to confirm dose calculation accuracy, indicating comparative analysis.
is_compared.quote: The comparison between egs_brachy and MCNP-BrachyGuide, summarized in Figure 3, yielded overall agreement within MC Type A uncertainty (see Table 2).

referenced_paper_title.justification: The overview paper on MCNP6 underlines its utility and updates that are relevant to the code version used in the study.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Goorley T, James M, Booth T, et al. Initial MCNP6 Release Overview.

name.value: Breast test case dataset for brachytherapy MBDCAs
name.justification: This dataset is explicitly constructed by the authors for commissioning brachytherapy model-based dose calculations and is available online.
name.quote: The dataset is available online at http://irochouston.mdanderson.org/rpc/BrachySeeds/BrachySeeds/index.html, https://doi.org/10.52519/00005.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The dataset is contributed as an original part of the work presented in the paper and does not reference an external paper for its primary data.
referenced_paper_title.quote: The dataset facilitates the commissioning of brachytherapy MBDCAs using TPS embedded tools and establishes a methodology for the development of future clinical test cases.

name.justification: The library 'MATLAB' is used in the preparation of computational models and exporting DICOM files.
name.quote: The model was written to a series of DICOM CT images using MATLAB. The model was imported...

referenced_paper_title.justification: MATLAB is a commonly known commercial software library, and its usage in the study doesn't require referencing a specific paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: MATLAB R2013b, The MathWorks Inc., Natick, MA
